business.headline: Two new GST levies may replace compensation cess, but at what cost?Health and Clean Energy levies may replace the Compensation Cess, but tax experts warn of rising compliance burdens and fresh coordination challenges.

Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai next month, sell China-made EVs: ReportTesla is set to open its first showroom in Mumbai next month and sell Model Y rear-wheel-drive SUVs shipped from Tesla's China factory as the company seeks expansion in the world's third-biggest automobile market, Bloomberg News reported.

India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

Sensex ends 1,046 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Bharti Airtel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,046.30 points to end at 82,408.17, while the NSE Nifty50 added 319.50 points to close at 25,112.40.

Is lifestyle inflation fuelling debt among India's middle class?Lifestyle inflation is no longer a silent threat. It is reshaping how India's middle class earns, spends and saves. It fuels debt, shrinks buffers and puts long-term financial goals at risk.

Planning to retire at 40? Here's what it really takesThe idea of retiring at 40 sounds almost rebellious. Stop working just when most people are hitting their career peak, and live the rest of your life on your own terms. No bosses, no Monday blues, no waiting for the weekend. But can you do it?

CA explains how Rs 80,000 per month income can beat Rs 2 lakhThe CA's insights suggest that intentional financial management is key to wealth building. A clear financial purpose can transform how resources are allocated, leading to sustainable growth.

Sensex jumps over 1,100 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The primary catalyst for this rally was the RBI's announcement concerning infrastructure financing. The central bank has implemented new norms that relax provisioning requirements for under-construction infrastructure projects.

Power Finance Corporation share price jumps 6% today. Here's whyWhile PFC has faced some pressure in recent months, with its stock falling 9.14% in the last six months and 14.44% over the past year, Friday's gain marks a strong rebound following the regulatory update.
Sensex opens 228 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; Nestle gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 160.43 points to 81,522.30, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,829.70 as of 9:23 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market open higher? Check key levelsAs of 8:00 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,800. This suggests that the Nifty50 may open near its previous closing level of 24,793.25.

Stocks to watch today: Oswal Pumps, Biocon, United Spirits, Sai Life SciencesShares of Nestle India could be in focus after the company announced that its Board of Directors will meet on June 26. They will consider a proposal to issue bonus shares.

entertainment.headline: Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty get lost in Pune, board crowded metro to reach hotelActors Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty travelled in a crowded metro recently after they got lost in Pune. They are shooting for 'Border 2' in the city.

Rapper Tommy Genesis faces backlash for dressing as Maa Kali in explicit music videoA Canadian rapper is facing backlash for portraying Maa Kali in an explicit video. The act has sparked outrage and renewed debate over cultural appropriation in entertainment.

Kuberaa box office Day 2: Dhanush's crime-thriller shows growth, crosses Rs 30 crore'Kuberaa' is going strong at the box office and has earned Rs 30 crore. On day 2, the Dhanush-starrer earned Rs 16 crore at the box office.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 2: Aamir's film outshines itself, earns Rs 30 croreAamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is steadily winning over audiences, showing promising signs at the box office. Boosted by positive word of mouth, the film continued to draw consistent footfall on Day 2, reflecting growing momentum after a solid opening.
Dipika Kakar wishes son Ruhaan on 2nd birthday with adorable candid videoV actor Dipika Kakar shared an adorable birthday wish for her son Ruhaan. The little munchkin turned two on June 22.

Aandhi: A cinematic storm that echoed Indira's era'Aandhi' is a classic political satire that delicately portrays the personal sacrifices behind public power, drawing subtle parallels with Indira Gandhi's life. The film remains a timeless gem, celebrated for its nuanced storytelling and memorable performances in Indian cinema.

Salman Khan, 59, says he has brain aneurysm and AV malformationSalman Khan spoke candidly about his severe health issues, including trigeminal neuralgia, AV malformation and brain aneurysm, during his appearance on The Great Indian Kapil Show.
Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar dies by suicide at 34Marathi actor Tushar Ghadigaonkar was found dead in his Goregaon West flat. Police suspect suicide caused by prolonged stress over lack of work.

Amitabh Bachchan admires son Abhishek, calls him true inheritor in new postAmitabh Bachchan has expressed heartfelt admiration for his son Abhishek Bachchan's dedication and courage as an artist. The proud father also shared his blessings for his upcoming film 'Kaalidhar Laapata'.

Veteran actor Jack Betts, known for Spider-Man, dies at 96Actor Jack Betts, renowned for his role as Henry Balkan in 'Spider-Man', died peacefully at his home. Tributes poured in from fans and theatre communities remembering his remarkable career.

Jana Nayagan: Thalapathy Vijay's first glimpse out on 51st birthdayThalapathy Vijay's final film 'Jana Nayagan' teaser was unveiled on his 51st birthday, showing him in a fierce police avatar. The film will release on January 9, 2026.

Salman Khan's Tere Naam look was inspired by APJ Abdul KalamActor Salman Khan revealed that his look in 'Tere Naam' was inspired by Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. He made this revelation during his appearance on the new season of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'.
Mohanlal announces Drishyam 3, eyes October 2025 releaseThe much-anticipated 'Drishyam 3', starring Mohanlal, has been announced. The actor shared the announcement on June 21.

Kaalidhar Laapata trailer: Abhishek Bachchan seeks joy in slice-of-life filmAfter 'Housefull 5', actor Abhishek Bachchan is set to surprise fans with a new avatar in his upcoming film 'Kaalidhar Laapata'. The trailer for the film, which will premiere on Zee5, was released on Saturday.

Yeh Rishta... actor Lataa Saberwal announces separation from husband Sanjeev SethTV actor Lataa Saberwal has announced her separation from her actor-husband Sanjeev Seth. The duo met on the sets of 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' and got married in 2009.

Was given a bowl to pee: Randeep Hooda on his wedding ceremony with Lin LaishramActor Randeep Hooda shared the nuances of his traditional Manipuri wedding ceremony with Lin Laishram. The actor recalled that he was given a bowl to pee during the ceremony.

Sunjay Kapur's final moments: CPR attempted after heart attack during polo matchBusinessman and Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur, died of a heart attack during a polo match in England. His funeral was held in New Delhi, with family and friends in attendance.

Allu Arjun shares sweet birthday wish for mother Nirmala with cute picTollywood actor Allu Arjun wished his mother, Nirmala Allu, on her birthday on Saturday. Along with the note, he posted an adorable picture of himself with her.

28 Years Later review: Danny Boyle proves third time's a charm in this zombie follow-upReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025'28 Years Later', the third installment in the franchise, brings fresh energy to the zombie genre with a gripping story. Danny Boyle's direction and strong performances make it a thrilling watch that honours the legacy of the original '28 Days Later'.

general news.headline: PM dials Iran President after US strikes on nuke sites, calls for de-escalationExpressed deep concern: PM Modi dials Iran President after US strikes on nuke sites, calls for de-escalation

Live: Response to aggression first, then diplomacy, says Iranian Foreign MinisterIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: The Israeli military on Sunday launched a fresh series of strikes targeting military targets including missile launchers in western Iran after Tehran launched two waves of missiles at multiple locations across northern and central Israel, including Haifa, Nes Ziona, Rishon LeZion and Tel Aviv. Iran's attack on Sunday morning came hours after the United States attacked the country's three nuclear sites: Fordow, Natanz and Esfahan. After days of deliberation, Trump's move to join Israel's military campaign marks a significant escalation in the regional conflict, which is on its tenth day. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Two caught for harbouring Pahalgam attackers, three LeT terrorists identifiedThe arrested accused, Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar and Bashir Ahmad Jothar, also disclosed the names of three of the terrorists involved in the April 22 attack, in which 25 tourists and a local were killed.

Outrageous: Iran says US strikes on N-sites will have everlasting consequencesAraghchi said the attacks on Iran's peaceful nuclear program were "outrageous" and would carry "everlasting consequences."

Trump sought 2 weeks to decide on Iran attack: Why he struck nuke sites in 2 daysIn the days leading up to the US attack on Iran's Fordow site, satellite imagery revealed increased vehicular activity near the entrance of the underground military complex.

Day 3 Live: Prasidh dismisses Ollie PopeEngland (ENG) vs India (IND), 1st Test Day 3 Live Score and Updates: Prasidh Krishna has got the early breakthrough for India in the morning. He has sent back England vice captain Ollie Pope. This is a huge reprieve for  India who were looking to overturn the momentum in this Test match.

Concerned: Pak condemns US strikes on Iran after nominating Trump for Nobel PrizeThe US struck Iran's Fordow, Natanz and Esfahan nuclear sites early Sunday, prompting Pakistan to call the escalation "deeply disturbing" and a "violation of international law" and UN norms.

Here's how Iran could retaliate after US strikes on its nuclear programA decision to retaliate against the US and its regional allies would give Iran a far larger target bank and one that is much closer than Israel, allowing it to potentially use its missiles and drones to greater effect.

Why height is a big filter in dating, marriage marketTinder's new height filter has formalised what was once an unspoken bias, height, as a key marker of desirability, especially for men. From arranged marriage proposals to queer dating spaces, taller men are still preferred, often tied to outdated ideas of masculinity, safety, and status.

Iran's nuclear facilities completely obliterated: Trump issues peace ultimatumIn his address to the nation, US President Donald Trump said that American forces conducted successful airstrikes on Iran's Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan nuclear sites, calling them a major blow to Tehran's nuclear program.

Alarmed: How China, Saudi, UK, others reacted to US strikes on Iran's N-sitesThe US strike on Iran's nuclear sites drew fierce global reactions — from Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's applause to the United States and Latin American leaders warning of legal violations and an escalating regional crisis.

Bold move to defend world from nuke terrorism: Israel envoy on US strikes in IranDismissing UN chief Antonio Guterres's 'dangerous escalation' claims, Israeli Ambassador to India Reuven Azar said he should have condemned Tehran's violations, as 'Iran has been cheating the world for the last thirty years.'

India's quantum leap: How Isro and DRDO are building an unhackable futureAt the heart of this revolution is quantum entanglement, a phenomenon Albert Einstein famously described as "spooky action at a distance."

Fordow, Natanz, Isfahan: All about Iran's nuclear sites bombed by USPresident Donald Trump said the strikes, which he described as 'very successful,' had hit the Natanz, Fordow and Isfahan sites, with Fordow being the primary target. Iran's state-run IRNA news agency confirmed there were attacks early Sunday at all three nuclear sites.

Huge traffic jam in Jaipur as couple's intimate moment at hotel draws crowdThe uncovered bedroom window overlooked a bustling street where vehicles abruptly stopped as drivers became aware of the scene causing a traffic jam.

Click, Learn, Repeat? Not yet. 2 of 3 Indians prefer degrees over online coursesDespite the rise of short-term courses globally, 66% of Indian professionals still see traditional degrees as more valuable for career growth, especially in the long-term, says the TeamLease EdTech report.

Entrepreneur couple's 'Bengaluru is slowly killing us' video sparks debateA Bengaluru-based couple decided to leave the city, blaming its worsening air quality for frequent illnesses. They documented their experience in a now-viral video on Instagram, which has sparked debate online.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Meghalaya murder case: Indore property dealer arrested for destroying evidenceThe property dealer allegedly disposed of a black bag belonging to the main murder accused, Sonam Raghuvanshi. The bag contained Rs 5 lakh in cash, her jewellery, a country-made pistol and her clothes -- all items were linked to the probe, the police told India Today TV.

Trump stopped Iran from going nuclear, history will remember: NetanyahuIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu lauded what he called a 'bold decision' by US President Donald Trump to bomb Iran's nuclear sites, saying it would 'change history.'

Aandhi: A cinematic storm that echoed Indira's era'Aandhi' is a classic political satire that delicately portrays the personal sacrifices behind public power, drawing subtle parallels with Indira Gandhi's life. The film remains a timeless gem, celebrated for its nuanced storytelling and memorable performances in Indian cinema.

Iran launches fresh missile attack at Israel after US strikes, several injuredIsraeli media reported that multiple regions in the country were hit by the latest Iranian strikes. Several eyewitnesses told Reuters that multiple explosions were heard in central Israel. Among the places hit were Haifa, Nes Ziona, the Rishon Lezion area, and Tel Aviv.

Salman Khan, 59, says he has brain aneurysm and AV malformationSalman Khan spoke candidly about his severe health issues, including trigeminal neuralgia, AV malformation and brain aneurysm, during his appearance on The Great Indian Kapil Show.

Aviation body launches safety audit framework after Air India crashThe audit covers airlines, maintenance organisations, flying schools, and ground handlers, with officials conducting inspections, interviews, and simulations to assess safety practices, regulatory compliance, and crew performance standards.

sports.headline: Manjrekar compares Bumrah to Hadlee for breakthrough bowling on flat pitchesFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar lavished praise on Jasprit Bumrah for his uncanny ability to produce breakthroughs even on batting-friendly surfaces, comparing the Indian pace spearhead to New Zealand legend Sir Richard Hadlee—the first cricketer to reach 400 Test wickets.

Day 3 Live: It is Bumrah vs England batters in morning sessionEngland (ENG) vs India (IND), 1st Test Day 3 Live Score and Updates: England begin Day 3 with 209 runs on board for the loss of 3 wickets. They have clawed their way back into this game after India put in a superb batting show for the first one and a half days.

Canada qualify for men's T20 World Cup 2026 with win vs BahamaThe Canadian men's cricket team has qualified for next year's ICC T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka after defeating the Bahamas by seven wickets in the Americas Qualifiers.

Jon Jones retires from UFC before highly anticipated fight against Tom AspinallJon Jones has officially retired from UFC, leaving the heavyweight title vacant. He calls time on his career right before his much-anticipated fight against Tom Aspinall.

Rishabh Pant plays the numbers game beautifully, has his own computer: ShastriFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri said Rishabh Pant 'plays the numbers game beautifully and has his own computer, the workings of which only he understands,' after the swashbuckling wicketkeeper-batter's audacious and entertaining show against England in the opening Test.

Sourav Ganguly rates Gautam Gambhir's coaching style, open to India roleFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly reveals interest in coaching the national team. He also praises Gautam Gambhir's passion, anticipating growth in his coaching journey.

Karthik questions Gambhir's communication with Pant in Leeds Test collapseFormer India wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik said Rishabh Pant was perhaps asked to curb his natural stroke-play, which ultimately led to the perplexing leave that cost him his wicket.

No fielding medals for Indian team: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar criticised India's fielding after three dropped catches on Day 2 of the first Test against England. India's sloppy fielding allowed England to recover strongly.

Real Madrid's Mbappe skips training again, set to miss Pachuca gameReal Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe missed Saturday's team training and is expected to sit out their Club World Cup Group H clash against Pachuca as he continues to recover from illness, the club confirmed.

Bumrah and the rest: Karthik fumes as India continue to repeat mistakesEngland vs India: Dinesh Karthik criticised India's reliance on Jasprit Bumrah after Day 2 of the first Test against England. Concerns grow over Bumrah's workload as other pacers fail to match his impact.

Sourav Ganguly rates Gautam Gambhir's coaching style, open to India roleFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly reveals interest in coaching the national team. He also praises Gautam Gambhir's passion, anticipating growth in his coaching journey.

Karthik questions Gambhir's communication with Pant in Leeds Test collapseFormer India wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik said Rishabh Pant was perhaps asked to curb his natural stroke-play, which ultimately led to the perplexing leave that cost him his wicket.

No fielding medals for Indian team: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar criticised India's fielding after three dropped catches on Day 2 of the first Test against England. India's sloppy fielding allowed England to recover strongly.

Real Madrid's Mbappe skips training again, set to miss Pachuca gameReal Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe missed Saturday's team training and is expected to sit out their Club World Cup Group H clash against Pachuca as he continues to recover from illness, the club confirmed.

Bumrah and the rest: Karthik fumes as India continue to repeat mistakesEngland vs India: Dinesh Karthik criticised India's reliance on Jasprit Bumrah after Day 2 of the first Test against England. Concerns grow over Bumrah's workload as other pacers fail to match his impact.

Ravi Shastri turns umpire in comm box but Joe Root survives an LBW scareFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri turned umpire in the commentary box in response to an LBW appeal by Mohammed Siraj against Joe Root on Day 2 of the ongoing first Test.

Jasprit Bumrah was extremely hard to face but we minimised the damage: DuckettEngland opener Ben Duckett said Jasprit Bumrah was the best fast bowler in the world and extremely tough to face at Headingley, but he and Ollie Pope managed to find a way to tackle him in the first Test.

Pant makes his own plans: Batting coach praises India star's Leeds hundredIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said Rishabh Pant's stroke-filled 134 was different from his typically aggressive knocks, as the wicketkeeper showed more restraint and control during his innings. Kotak also admitted that India could not capitalise on their strong position and fell short of the first-innings total they had targeted in the opening Test against England.

Ravi Shastri fumes at lack of support for Jasprit Bumrah in Leeds TestENG vs IND: Former India coach Ravi Shastri was full of praise for Jasprit Bumrah but felt the premier pacer did not get any support from the rest of the bowling attack, with a visible difference in quality.

Jasprit Bumrah is the best bowler in the world right now: England pacer WoodENG vs IND: England pacer Mark Wood has heaped praise on Jasprit Bumrah, calling him the best bowler in the world at present and a genuine match-winner across formats.

Inter beat Urawa, Bellingham helps Dortmund survive Mamelodi scareInter Milan came from behind to defeat Urawa Red Diamonds 2-1 in a thrilling FIFA Club World Cup match. Jobe Bellingham scored his first goal for Borussia Dortmund, helping the Bundesliga side beat Mamelodi Sundowns 4-3.

Archer inches closer to full fitness, eyes red-ball return for Sussex: ReportEnglish fast bowler Jofra Archer is reportedly set to make his return to red-ball cricket, having been picked for Sussex's upcoming County Championship match against Durham. His performance in the game could determine his chances of featuring in the ongoing Test series against India.

Ollie Pope's century gave me goosebumps: Duckett praises Headingley heroBen Duckett praised Ollie Pope's composed century at Headingley, admitting he got goosebumps watching his teammate reach the milestone. Their 122-run partnership proved pivotal, shifting momentum England's way after early pressure from Jasprit Bumrah and the Indian attack.

Jasprit Bumrah is the best bowler in the world right now: England pacer WoodENG vs IND: England pacer Mark Wood has heaped praise on Jasprit Bumrah, calling him the best bowler in the world at present and a genuine match-winner across formats.

Inter beat Urawa, Bellingham helps Dortmund survive Mamelodi scareInter Milan came from behind to defeat Urawa Red Diamonds 2-1 in a thrilling FIFA Club World Cup match. Jobe Bellingham scored his first goal for Borussia Dortmund, helping the Bundesliga side beat Mamelodi Sundowns 4-3.

Archer inches closer to full fitness, eyes red-ball return for Sussex: ReportEnglish fast bowler Jofra Archer is reportedly set to make his return to red-ball cricket, having been picked for Sussex's upcoming County Championship match against Durham. His performance in the game could determine his chances of featuring in the ongoing Test series against India.

Ollie Pope's century gave me goosebumps: Duckett praises Headingley heroBen Duckett praised Ollie Pope's composed century at Headingley, admitting he got goosebumps watching his teammate reach the milestone. Their 122-run partnership proved pivotal, shifting momentum England's way after early pressure from Jasprit Bumrah and the Indian attack.

India batting coach rues dropped catches against England in Leeds TestIndia batting coach Shitanshu Kotak described the team's poor fielding on Day 2 as "one of those unfortunate days", with dropped catches and misfields allowing England to wrest back control after India's strong start at Headingley.

How to tackle Bumrah? Duckett reveals England batters' Leeds Test planBen Duckett revealed that staying positive was key for him and Ollie Pope in countering Jasprit Bumrah's pace threat, as their 122-run stand rescued England after an early blow on Day 2 of the Headingley Test against India.

BCCI to enforce strict rules, security for IPL celebrations: Devajit SaikiaAfter the tragic Bengaluru stampede during RCB's IPL celebrations, BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed strict new rules will be enforced for future victory parades to ensure public safety and prevent any such mishap again.

ENG vs IND, 1st Test: Bumrah wages lone battle after India collapse on Day 2England dominated the proceedings on Day 2 of the first Test match against India at Headingley, Leeds as they first bundled out India for 471 and later finished on 209/3 at stumps. Jasprit Bumrah emerged as the lone warrior for India with the ball, registering figures of 3/48.

Jasprit Bumrah hides face in frustration as Jaiswal drops Ollie PopeIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah was seen hiding his face in frustration after Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped Ollie Pope during the last session on Day 2 of the second Test against England at Headingley, Leeds.

Sourav Ganguly urges India to go all-out and win 1st Test vs EnglandENG vs IND: Sourav Ganguly feels India should have gone on to score 600 runs in the first innings. Nonetheless, he wants the Indian team to go all-out and take the win, considering their impressive start with the bat in Headingley.

Sachin Tendulkar dissects Rishabh Pant's clever strategy behind paddle sweepLegendary India batter Sachin Tendulkar dissected Rishabh Pant's clever paddle sweep strategy, following his remarkable century against England on Day 2 of the first Test in Leeds.

Beating England, Australia: Mathews picks top Test memories after goodbyeAngelo Mathews marked the end of his Test career by picking Sri Lanka's 2014 series win in England and the 2016 whitewash of Australia as the proudest moments of his 15-year red-ball journey.

Rishabh Pant well ahead of MS Dhoni in Tests: Manjrekar makes bold claimSanjay Manjrekar has backed Rishabh Pant as India's best wicketkeeper-batter in the longest format, surpassing even MS Dhoni. The former cricketer highlighted how Pant's impressive record when playing away from home puts him ahead.

SL vs BAN 1st Test: Sri Lanka hold on for draw after Shanto slams twin centuriesSri Lanka held on for a draw on Day 5 of the first Test against Bangladesh in Galle after Najmul Hossain Shanto slammed twin hundreds in the match.

SL vs BAN: Shanto creates history, joins list with multiple twin tons in TestsNajmul Hossain Shanto finds himself in a rare list of players who have recorded multiple instances of twin centuries in Test cricket. He was in form with the bat as Bangladesh went on to secure a draw against Sri Lanka at Galle.

ENG vs IND: Karun Nair dismissed for duck on Test return after eight yearsIndia batter Karun Nair was dismissed for a duck on his comeback to the Indian Test team after eight years on Day 2 of the first Test against England at Headingley, Leeds.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
